py_sim.dynamics.differential_drive module¶

differential_drive.py defines types, functions, and classes for the dynamics of a differential drive robot

class py_sim.dynamics.differential_drive.DiffDriveControl(mu_r: float = 0.0, mu_l: float = 0.0, vec: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]] | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Stores the inputs required for the differential drive dynamics (wheel rotational velocities)

IND_R¶

The index of the rotational velocity of the right wheel

Type:

int

IND_L¶

The index of the rotational velocity of the left wheel

Type:

int

input¶

The input vector

Type:

NDArray[Any]

n_inputs¶

The number of inputs (i.e., rows in input)

Type:

int

mu_l¶

The value of the left wheel rotational velocity

Type:

float

mu_r¶

The value of the right wheel rotational velocity

Type:

float

IND_L: int = 1¶
IND_R: int = 0¶
property mu_l: float¶

Return the rotational velocity value

property mu_r: float¶

Return the translational velocity

n_inputs: int = 2¶
class py_sim.dynamics.differential_drive.DiffDriveParams(L: float, R: float)¶

Bases: object

Provides the parameters for a differential drive model

L¶

The length between the wheels

Type:

float

R¶

The radius of the wheels

float

py_sim.dynamics.differential_drive.arc_control(time: float, state: UnicycleState, dyn_params: DiffDriveParams, cont_params: ArcParams) → DiffDriveControl¶

Implements the control for a circular arc

Parameters:

  • time – clock time

  • state – vehicle state

  • params – control parameters

Returns:

The commanded wheel rotational velocities

Return type:

DiffDriveControl

py_sim.dynamics.differential_drive.dynamics(state: UnicycleState, control: DiffDriveControl, params: DiffDriveParams) → UnicycleState¶

Calculates the dynamics of the unicycle.

Note that even though a “DiffDriveState” is returned, that actually corresponds to the time derivative

d/dt x = v cos(psi) d/dt y = v sin(spi) d/dt psi = w

where v = (mu_r + mu_l)/2 and w = (R/L)(mu_r-mu_l)

Parameters:

  • state – The current state of the vehicle

  • control – The current input of the vehicle

  • params – The vehicle parameters

Returns:

The resulting state time derivative

Return type:

DiffDriveState

py_sim.dynamics.differential_drive.velocity_control(time: float, state: UnicycleState, dyn_params: DiffDriveParams, vd: float, wd: float) → DiffDriveControl¶

Implements a velocity control for the unicycle, which is simply copying the desired inputs

Parameters:

  • time – clock time (not used)

  • state – vehicle state (not used)

  • vd – Desired translational velocity

  • wd – Desired rotational velocity

Returns:

The commanded wheel rotational velocities

Return type:

DiffDriveControl

py_sim.dynamics.differential_drive.velocity_vector_field_control(time: float, state: UnicycleState, vec: TwoDimArray, dyn_params: DiffDriveParams, cont_params: UniVelVecParamsProto) → DiffDriveControl¶

velocity_vector_field_control will calculate the desired control to follow a vector field with the following inputs:

Parameters:

  • time – The time for which the control is being calculated

  • state – The state of the unicycle

  • vec – The vector to be followed

  • params – Parameters defining the control

Returns:

The commanded wheel rotational velocities

Return type:

DiffDriveControl
